text: Initiation of DNA replication requires the function of MCM gene products , which participate in ensuring that DNA replication occurs only once in the cell cycle .
Expression of all mammalian genes of the MCM family is induced by growth stimulation , unlike yeast , and the mRNA levels peak at G1 / S boundary .
In this study , we examined the transcriptional activities of isolated human MCM gene promoters .

Human <extra_id_0> MCM5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> MCM6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoters with mutation in the E2F sites failed in promoter regulation following serum stimulation and exogenous E2F expression .

text: In addition , we identified a novel E2F-like sequence in human <extra_id_0> MCM6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter which cooperates with the authentic E2F sites in E2F - dependent regulation .
Forced expression of <extra_id_0> E2F1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could induce expression of all members of the endogenous MCM genes in rat embryonal fibroblast REF52 cells .

Our results demonstrated that the growth - regulated expression of mammalian <extra_id_0> MCM5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> MCM6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> genes , and presumably other MCM members , is primarily regulated by E2F through binding to multiple E2F sites in the promoters .
